e4: In light of potential legal risk, protecting retail investors, and promoting transparency & ethical corporate practices, recommend changing the policy to report unbiased earnings, while communicating the change effectively to investors.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency and accuracy, minimizing any biased or misleading practices. It would consider legal risks, investor protection and fairness, and align with professional standards or regulations. The new, unbiased policy, while challenging to communicate effectively to investors, better protects less sophisticated retail investors and promotes ethical corporate governance.
e6: It would be beneficial to ask CFO questions about potential communication strategies to mitigate any negative market reaction and protect retail investors upon changing to the new policy. Seek assurances on internal oversight mechanisms to prevent management from reverting back to previous practices in order to address concerns about the impact on small investors.
q9: The first JSON object discusses the ethical dilemma of a company that over-reports its earnings and the potential consequences when considering whether to change their reporting policy. In this case, there is no definitive answer to the question about the interstellar object detected passing through our solar system.
